title: As NASA increasingly relies on commercial space, there are some troubling signs
summary: "The government's really got to look at itself."

title: ESA Award Another €230M to ArianeGroup for Themis Demonstrator
summary:
The European Space Agency has announced that it has awarded two new contracts to ArianeGroup to build a second Themis demonstrator and to refine the design of its Prometheus rocket engine. The two contracts have a combined value of €230 million. Themis was initially introduced as a CNES project in 2018 and was then adopted […]
The post ESA Award Another €230M to ArianeGroup for Themis Demonstrator appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: European space companies seek more competitive government contracts
summary:
Companies and investors want European governments to take more risks and buy services from space startups, rather than awarding grants, to make the industry more competitive with American counterparts.
The post European space companies seek more competitive government contracts appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sols 4368-4369: The Colors of Fall – and Mars
summary: Earth planning date: Monday, Nov. 18, 2024 I am in the U.K., where we are approaching the time when trees are just branches and twigs. One tree that still has its full foliage is my little quince tree in my front garden. Its leaves have turned reddish-brown with a hint of orange, fairly dark by […]

title: Investors betting on space growth under Trump administration
summary: Investors are preparing for the incoming Trump administration to expand the defense budgets driving the space industry’s growth.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 24 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 6-66 mission comes near the end of a week during which SpaceX launched three Falcon 9 rockets in less than 20 hours and a Starship rocket. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 11:07 a.m. EST (1607 UTC).

title: Space Force chief observes Starship test launch, signaling military interest
summary: The Space Force is ‘monitoring Starship's progress and look forward to potentially leveraging its capabilities in the future’

title: Transforming Geospatial Intelligence: Data Labeling for AI – Webinar Replay
summary: Join us November 20 at 1:00 PM EST for a discussion on a groundbreaking initiative from the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) — a $700 million investment in data labeling to empower artificial intelligence in geospatial intelligence.
